intro: Cousinia sewerzowii, commonly known as the Armenian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, grayish-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Cousinia sewerzowii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its hardy nature and aesthetic features.
